p: P. cubeba and P. nigrum EOs increased electrolyte leakage and MDA contents of B. pilosa and E. crus-galli at 1.93 mg/mL dose of treatments. This condition indicated that membranes of the two indicator plants were disrupted and loss of their integrity [ 40]. Our results agree with previous studies which reported that Artemesia scoparia and Tagetes erecta EOs induced electrolyte leakage and MDA accumulation [ 1, 41]. Monoterpenes compounds have been reported to disrupt cell membrane permeability that stimulate MDA accumulation. Consequently, cellular potassium was leakage and inhibited glucose-dependent respiration [ 42].
